capabilities.name: Agent Mode
capabilities.description: Open-source terminal AI agent that autonomously queries and modifies codebases, generates applications from multimodal inputs, and automates operational tasks

capabilities.name: Sub-agents
capabilities.description: Gemini CLI can spawn subagent processes to handle specialized subtasks in parallel. Subagents are currently an experimental feature enabling delegation of focused work items to subsidiary agent processes.

sources.description: Gemini CLI repository - experimental subagent support for delegating subtasks
sources.excerpt: Subagents are currently an experimental feature. Gemini CLI can delegate tasks to subsidiary subagent processes for specialized work.

capabilities.name: Custom Instructions
capabilities.description: GEMINI.md context files for project-specific behavior, coding standards, and architectural context (auto-loaded from project, user home, and system levels). Configurable system instructions and multiple output formats (text, JSON, streaming). Cascading configuration allows per-project overrides of user/system defaults.

sources.description: Gemini CLI repository - GEMINI.md context files and configurable system instructions
sources.excerpt: Custom context files (GEMINI.md) to tailor behavior for your projects with configurable system instructions and output formats.

capabilities.name: Extended Thinking
capabilities.description: Access to Gemini reasoning models (Gemini 2.5 Pro and above) that perform extended chain-of-thought reasoning before responding. Selectable via --model flag for complex problem solving, architecture analysis, and multi-step tasks.

sources.description: Gemini CLI repository - access to Gemini reasoning models with extended thinking
sources.excerpt: Access to improved reasoning and 1M token context window for processing large codebases with Gemini API models including Gemini 2.5 Pro.

sources.description: Gemini API documentation - reasoning model capabilities
sources.excerpt: Gemini API documentation covering reasoning model capabilities, extended thinking performance, and model-specific features for complex tasks.

capabilities.name: Vision
capabilities.description: Analyze images, PDFs, and sketches as input. Generate applications from visual designs and wireframes, and process visual content for code understanding.

sources.description: Gemini CLI repository - multimodal image and PDF input for code generation
sources.excerpt: Generate new apps from PDFs, images, or sketches using multimodal capabilities and the power of Gemini models.

capabilities.name: Prompt and Context Inspector
capabilities.description: /memory show displays loaded GEMINI.md instructional context for the session. /about shows version and diagnostic info. Structured exit codes (41=auth, 42=input, 44=sandbox, 52=config, 53=turn-limit) for programmatic error identification. recordResponses and fakeResponses config fields support testing and replay of model interactions.

sources.description: Gemini CLI repository - /memory show, /about commands, structured exit codes
sources.excerpt: Gemini CLI provides /memory show for loaded GEMINI.md context, /about for version and diagnostics, and structured exit codes.

sources.description: Gemini CLI releases - observability feature updates
sources.excerpt: Gemini CLI releases tracking observability feature updates including diagnostic commands and context inspection.

capabilities.name: Debug Logging
capabilities.description: --debug flag and F12 debug console in interactive mode. DEBUG_MODE env var for core component verbosity. WebSocket network logging with streaming diagnostics. Debug log auto-truncation prevents memory issues. Developer tracing via GEMINI_DEV_TRACING=true env var instruments model calls, tool scheduler, and tool calls, viewable in Genkit (localhost:4000) or Jaeger (localhost:16686) UIs.

sources.description: Gemini CLI repository - --debug flag, F12 console, DEBUG_MODE, GEMINI_DEV_TRACING
sources.excerpt: Gemini CLI provides --debug flag, F12 debug console, DEBUG_MODE env var, and GEMINI_DEV_TRACING for developer tracing.

sources.description: Gemini CLI releases - debugging feature updates
sources.excerpt: Gemini CLI releases tracking debugging feature updates including debug flag enhancements and tracing improvements.

capabilities.name: Usage Tracking
capabilities.description: /stats displays session token usage, cached token savings (API key auth only), and session duration. Headless --output-format json includes stats object with token and latency metrics. Full OpenTelemetry telemetry (opt-in, disabled by default) tracking sessions, tool execution, file operations, API interactions, model routing, and performance. Exports to GCP or local OTLP endpoint.

sources.description: Gemini CLI repository - /stats, OpenTelemetry telemetry, headless JSON output with metrics
sources.excerpt: Gemini CLI /stats displays session token usage, cached token savings, and session duration with OpenTelemetry telemetry support.

sources.description: Gemini CLI releases - usage tracking feature updates
sources.excerpt: Gemini CLI releases tracking usage tracking feature updates including /stats and OpenTelemetry telemetry improvements.

capabilities.name: Lifecycle Hooks
capabilities.description: Eleven hook events (SessionStart, SessionEnd, BeforeAgent, AfterAgent, BeforeModel, AfterModel, BeforeToolSelection, BeforeTool, AfterTool, PreCompress, Notification) execute shell commands at agent lifecycle points. BeforeTool/AfterTool support regex matchers for tool filtering. Hooks can intercept, inject context, block operations, modify tool arguments, swap models, and redact responses. Configured in .gemini/settings.json at project, user, or system level. JSON stdin/stdout communication protocol. Project hooks are fingerprinted with security warnings on change.

sources.description: Gemini CLI hooks documentation - complete lifecycle hooks reference with 11 hook events

capabilities.name: Extension System
capabilities.description: Extensions package prompts, MCP servers, custom commands, themes, hooks, sub-agents, and agent skills into distributable units. Installed from GitHub repos via 'gemini extensions install URL'. Browsable gallery at geminicli.com/extensions/. Managed via /extensions list in interactive mode or 'gemini extensions' CLI command group.

sources.description: Gemini CLI Extensions documentation - packaging and distributing extensions with prompts, MCP servers, commands, themes, and hooks

capabilities.name: Code Refactoring
capabilities.description: Refactor code through agent mode â€” rename variables, extract functions, restructure files, and apply design patterns. Operates across multiple files with full codebase context via sandbox file operations.

sources.description: Gemini CLI repository - agent mode with multi-file code editing and refactoring capabilities
sources.excerpt: Gemini CLI's agentic mode autonomously reads, edits, and restructures code across multiple files to implement refactoring and generation tasks.

capabilities.name: Model Selection
capabilities.description: Choose between multiple Gemini models via --model flag. Available models: Gemini 2.5 Flash (default), Gemini 3 Pro, Gemini 3 Flash. Model can be set per-session or in .gemini/settings.json configuration.

sources.description: Gemini CLI repository - model selection via --model flag and configuration
sources.excerpt: Gemini CLI supports selecting between Gemini models via --model flag including Gemini 2.5 Flash, Gemini 3 Pro, and Gemini 3 Flash.
